input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: FAMILY, YOUTH AND SOCIAL AFFAIRS COUNSELING. Summary: The Purpose of This Contract is to Regulate the Conditions for Carrying out a Technical Advisory Service for Regional Planning of Public Policies on Aging.... Description: The purpose of this contract is to regulate the conditions for carrying out a technical advisory service for the regional planning of public policies regarding active aging and dependency prevention. Said Service Will Include An Investigation That Provides A Diagnosis On The Situation Of The Elderly Population Of The Community Of Madrid, Regarding Their Social Needs And Level Of Political And Social Participation, As Well As Information On The Resources That Public And Private Entities Allocate In Their Respective Territorial Areas To Elderly Care, Active Aging, Prevention Of Dependency And The Fight Against Unwanted Loneliness In Elderly 65 Years. The conclusions of all this will be reflected in two proposed documents for the next active aging plan, as well as for the rationalization of the internal management of the plan. Said advice will be aimed at the preparation of the new plan for active aging and dependency prevention (2027/2023), as well as the monitoring and evaluation of the measures contained therein.. Tender Value: 154400.36. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-11-03. Closing Date: 2025-11-18. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: FAMILY, YOUTH AND SOCIAL AFFAIRS COUNSELING
output.Summary: The Purpose of This Contract is to Regulate the Conditions for Carrying out a Technical Advisory Service for Regional Planning of Public Policies on Aging...
output.Description: The purpose of this contract is to regulate the conditions for carrying out a technical advisory service for the regional planning of public policies regarding active aging and dependency prevention. Said Service Will Include An Investigation That Provides A Diagnosis On The Situation Of The Elderly Population Of The Community Of Madrid, Regarding Their Social Needs And Level Of Political And Social Participation, As Well As Information On The Resources That Public And Private Entities Allocate In Their Respective Territorial Areas To Elderly Care, Active Aging, Prevention Of Dependency And The Fight Against Unwanted Loneliness In Elderly 65 Years. The conclusions of all this will be reflected in two proposed documents for the next active aging plan, as well as for the rationalization of the internal management of the plan. Said advice will be aimed at the preparation of the new plan for active aging and dependency prevention (2027/2023), as well as the monitoring and evaluation of the measures contained therein.

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: FUNDACIÓN MIGUEL SERVET. Summary: Pre-Commercial Procurement (Pcp) of Innovative and Sustainable Solutions to Treat Hospital and Healthcare System Wastewater - Theresa Pcp. Description: In preparation for the THERESA PCP, an Open Market Consultation (OMC) will be held between 22 December 2025 and 28 February 2026, aimed at engaging potential suppliers, research institutions and other stakeholders to inform and refine the procurement strategy and related functional and technical specifications. Activities foreseen include: Launch of the OMC (22 December 2025) with public announcement and registration; in January 2026, local and online events are planned in Spain, the Netherlands, Belgium, Estonia and Poland to present the project scope, requirements and PCP procedure; company pitch sessions; an online Request for Information (RFI) via EU Survey; a Q&A mechanism and matchmaking tool to support networking; bilateral meetings with suppliers; and a final event (26 February 2026) presenting results and next steps. All documents will be available in English. Any changes or updates to the OMC schedule, content, or documentation will be announced and published in a timely manner on the THERESA PCP project website: (www.theresa-pcp.eu/omc). <br> Doc Title: Pre-Commercial Procurement (PCP) of innovative and sustainable solutions to treat Hospital and Healthcare System Wastewater - THERESA PCP <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 2787925. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-10-31. Closing Date: 2025-12-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: FUNDACIÓN MIGUEL SERVET
output.Summary: Pre-Commercial Procurement (Pcp) of Innovative and Sustainable Solutions to Treat Hospital and Healthcare System Wastewater - Theresa Pcp

Summary: Pre-Commercial Procurement of an Innovative Systemic Sustainability Transition Solution for Health Care Organisations (Suhco). Description: Procurement will take the form of pre-commercial procurement (PCP), where R&D service contracts will be awarded in parallel to different R&D providers in a phased approach. This will allow alternative, competing solutions to be compared. Each selected operator will receive a framework contract covering three R&D phases. The three phases are: Solution design, prototype development, original development and validation and testing of a limited volume of the first products or services. After each phase, interim evaluations are conducted to select the best of the competing solutions. The contractors with the best value for money will be offered a specific contract for the next phase. The selected operators will retain ownership of the intellectual property rights (IPRs) they generate during the PCP and will be able to use them to exploit the full market potential of the solutions developed. All interested operators are invited to take part in the upcoming open market consultation (regardless of their geographic location , the size or governance structure of their organisation). The open market consultation will be organised in the form of a series of meetings. It will provide you with an overview of the procurement objectives, the PCP process and the main clauses of the contract. You will also have the opportunity to ask questions. The first series of meetings will be held online or hybrid by each of the procurers mentioned under Section I.1). During those meetings, the procurers .... Tender Value: 2260980. Currency: EUR. input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Generational Renewal in Agriculture - Exploring which Characteristics Could Increase Youth Demand for Farming. Description: This contract aims to collect primary data through on-line surveys, focus group discussions, semi-structured in-depth interview and online experiments that will inform the implementation of actions that make farming more attractive to young people both with and without farming background. The Commission will prepare draft version of all materials to be used in the data collection (questionnaires, discussion guides, and experimental designs). The contractor shall provide suggestions for improvement; program the surveys and experiments in their on-line survey platform of choice; recruit participants, assure completion of the tasks by the selected sample sizes meeting data quality, provide digital versions of the data; and report on data characteristics together with lessons learnt during the process. <br> Doc Title: Generational renewal in agriculture - exploring which characteristics could increase youth demand for farming <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 200000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-10-01. Closing Date: 2025-10-10. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Generational Renewal in Agriculture - Exploring which Characteristics Could Increase Youth Demand for Farming. Description: This contract aims to collect primary data through on-line surveys, focus group discussions, semi-structured in-depth interview and online experiments that will inform the implementation of actions that make farming more attractive to young people both with and without farming background. The Commission will prepare draft version of all materials to be used in the data collection (questionnaires, discussion guides, and experimental designs). The contractor shall provide suggestions for improvement; program the surveys and experiments in their on-line survey platform of choice; recruit participants, assure completion of the tasks by the selected sample sizes meeting data quality, provide digital versions of the data; and report on data characteristics together with lessons learnt during the process. <br> Doc Title: Generational renewal in agriculture - exploring which characteristics could increase youth demand for farming <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 200000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-08-25. Closing Date: 2025-09-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE

This need arises from the growing importance of chemical storage of energy "in the form of molecules ", also called chemical storage, in such a way that it is likely to be used at another posterior time. The platform will focus on CSS synthesis using fischer-trotpsch technology, using syngas generated from biomass, green hydrogen and co₂ biogenic. It will also allow advanced technological routes and hybridize with other energy storage systems already available in the center.<br> The solution must include the supply, installation and commissioning of all the necessary equipment and systems, integrating with the infrastructure existing, under criteria of energy efficiency, waste minimization and reuse of resources.<br> R&D projects in energy storage and energy efficiency of component 10: Fair transition of the PRTR, which contributes to the fulfillment of objective No. 142 of the Cid Annex.<br> In accordance with article 18 of the LCSP, in relation to the provisions of article 3 of the Directs .... input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Generational Renewal in Agriculture - Exploring which Characteristics Could Increase Youth Demand for Farming. Description: This contract aims to collect primary data through on-line surveys, focus group discussions, semi-structured in-depth interview and online experiments that will inform the implementation of actions that make farming more attractive to young people both with and without farming background. The Commission will prepare draft version of all materials to be used in the data collection (questionnaires, discussion guides, and experimental designs). The contractor shall provide suggestions for improvement; program the surveys and experiments in their on-line survey platform of choice; recruit participants, assure completion of the tasks by the selected sample sizes meeting data quality, provide digital versions of the data; and report on data characteristics together with lessons learnt during the process. <br> Doc Title: Generational renewal in agriculture - exploring which characteristics could increase youth demand for farming <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 200000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-07-24. Closing Date: 2025-09-24. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE
output.Summary: Generational Renewal in Agriculture - Exploring which Characteristics Could Increase Youth Demand for Farming

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Generational Renewal in Agriculture - Exploring which Characteristics Could Increase Youth Demand for Farming. Description: This contract aims to collect primary data through on-line surveys, focus group discussions, semi-structured in-depth interview and online experiments that will inform the implementation of actions that make farming more attractive to young people both with and without farming background. The Commission will prepare draft version of all materials to be used in the data collection (questionnaires, discussion guides, and experimental designs). The contractor shall provide suggestions for improvement; program the surveys and experiments in their on-line survey platform of choice; recruit participants, assure completion of the tasks by the selected sample sizes meeting data quality, provide digital versions of the data; and report on data characteristics together with lessons learnt during the process. <br> Doc Title: Generational renewal in agriculture - exploring which characteristics could increase youth demand for farming <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 200000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-05-06. Closing Date: 2025-06-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Data Collection, Validation & Harmonisation for the Eu Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-2028. Description: Since 2004, the Commission has produced the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards to analyse corporate R&D investment data and the positioning of EU-based companies compared to their global peers. The publication of the Scoreboard in December each year intends to raise awareness of the importance of R&D for businesses and to encourage firms to disclose information about their R&D investments and other intangible assets, provide economic analyses and inspire policy recommendations for Europe. The data for the Scoreboard come from companies- publicly available audited accounts. The main objective of this framework contract is data collection and validation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-28. The work shall be organised in annual cycles with regard to publication of the report each December. The approach is that, based on data provided by the Commission, the financial reports of up to 4000 firms shall be retrieved and several indicators should be gathered and validated for eligibility and accuracy. Moreover, this work involves cross-checking the data to establish a coherent and comprehensive final dataset, including occasional additional verifications after publication of the data in the Scoreboard report. <br> Doc Title: Data collection, validation & harmonisation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-2028 <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 750000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-04-07. Closing Date: 2025-04-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE
output.Summary: Data Collection, Validation & Harmonisation for the Eu Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-2028
output.Description: Since 2004, the Commission has produced the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards to analyse corporate R&D investment data and the positioning of EU-based companies compared to their global peers. The publication of the Scoreboard in December each year intends to raise awareness of the importance of R&D for businesses and to encourage firms to disclose information about their R&D investments and other intangible assets, provide economic analyses and inspire policy recommendations for Europe. The data for the Scoreboard come from companies- publicly available audited accounts. The main objective of this framework contract is data collection and validation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-28. The work shall be organised in annual cycles with regard to publication of the report each December. The approach is that, based on data provided by the Commission, the financial reports of up to 4000 firms shall be retrieved and several indicators should be gathered and validated for eligibility and accuracy. Moreover, this work involves cross-checking the data to establish a coherent and comprehensive final dataset, including occasional additional verifications after publication of the data in the Scoreboard report. <br> Doc Title: Data collection, validation & harmonisation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-2028 <br> Contract Type: services

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Data Collection, Validation & Harmonisation for the Eu Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-2028. Description: Since 2004, the Commission has produced the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards to analyse corporate R&D investment data and the positioning of EU-based companies compared to their global peers. The publication of the Scoreboard in December each year intends to raise awareness of the importance of R&D for businesses and to encourage firms to disclose information about their R&D investments and other intangible assets, provide economic analyses and inspire policy recommendations for Europe. The data for the Scoreboard come from companies- publicly available audited accounts. The main objective of this framework contract is data collection and validation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-28. The work shall be organised in annual cycles with regard to publication of the report each December. The approach is that, based on data provided by the Commission, the financial reports of up to 4000 firms shall be retrieved and several indicators should be gathered and validated for eligibility and accuracy. Moreover, this work involves cross-checking the data to establish a coherent and comprehensive final dataset, including occasional additional verifications after publication of the data in the Scoreboard report. <br> Doc Title: Data collection, validation & harmonisation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-2028 <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 750000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-03-19. Closing Date: 2025-04-21. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE
output.Summary: Data Collection, Validation & Harmonisation for the Eu Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-2028
output.Description: Since 2004, the Commission has produced the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards to analyse corporate R&D investment data and the positioning of EU-based companies compared to their global peers. The publication of the Scoreboard in December each year intends to raise awareness of the importance of R&D for businesses and to encourage firms to disclose information about their R&D investments and other intangible assets, provide economic analyses and inspire policy recommendations for Europe. The data for the Scoreboard come from companies- publicly available audited accounts. The main objective of this framework contract is data collection and validation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-28. The work shall be organised in annual cycles with regard to publication of the report each December. The approach is that, based on data provided by the Commission, the financial reports of up to 4000 firms shall be retrieved and several indicators should be gathered and validated for eligibility and accuracy. Moreover, this work involves cross-checking the data to establish a coherent and comprehensive final dataset, including occasional additional verifications after publication of the data in the Scoreboard report. <br> Doc Title: Data collection, validation & harmonisation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-2028 <br> Contract Type: services

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN AGENCY FOR SAFETY AND HEALTH AT WORK (EU-OSHA). Summary: Psychosocial Risks and Mental Health at Work: Facts and Figures. Description: The subject of this call for tenders is “Psychosocial risks and mental health at work: facts and figures". This project aims to provide a comprehensive overview of the state of play in terms of psychosocial risks and mental health at work in the EU, providing policy makers, social partners and the workplaces with better understanding of data and research evidence. The project-s aim is to present the main insights as well as gaps and limitations of the existing data, supporting preparations for EU-OSHA-s Healthy Workplaces Campaign “Together for mental health at work” (2026-28). <br> Doc Title: Psychosocial risks and mental health at work: facts and figures <br> Contract Type: services. This project aims to provide a comprehensive overview of the state of play in terms of psychosocial risks and mental health at work in the EU, providing policy makers, social partners and the workplaces with better understanding of data and research evidence. The project-s aim is to present the main insights as well as gaps and limitations of the existing data, supporting preparations for EU-OSHA-s Healthy Workplaces Campaign “Together for mental health at work” (2026-28). <br> Doc Title: Psychosocial risks and mental health at work: facts and figures <br> Contract Type: services

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Data Collection, Validation & Harmonisation for the Eu Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards. Description: Since 2004, the Commission has produced the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards to analyse corporate R&D investment data and the positioning of EU-based companies compared to their global peers. The publication of the Scoreboard in December each year intends to raise awareness of the importance of R&D for businesses and to encourage firms to disclose information about their R&D investments and other intangible assets, provide economic analyses and inspire policy recommendations for Europe. The data for the Scoreboard come from companies- publicly available audited accounts. The main objective of this framework contract is data collection and validation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-28. The work shall be organised in annual cycles with regard to publication of the report each December. The approach is that, based on data provided by the Commission, the financial reports of up to 4000 firms shall be retrieved and several indicators should be gathered and validated for eligibility and accuracy. Moreover, this work involves cross-checking the data to establish a coherent and comprehensive final dataset, including occasional additional verifications after publication of the data in the Scoreboard report. <br> Doc Title: Data collection, validation & harmonisation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 750000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-02-13. Closing Date: 2025-03-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE
output.Summary: Data Collection, Validation & Harmonisation for the Eu Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards
output.Description: Since 2004, the Commission has produced the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards to analyse corporate R&D investment data and the positioning of EU-based companies compared to their global peers. The publication of the Scoreboard in December each year intends to raise awareness of the importance of R&D for businesses and to encourage firms to disclose information about their R&D investments and other intangible assets, provide economic analyses and inspire policy recommendations for Europe. The data for the Scoreboard come from companies- publicly available audited accounts. The main objective of this framework contract is data collection and validation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-28. The work shall be organised in annual cycles with regard to publication of the report each December. The approach is that, based on data provided by the Commission, the financial reports of up to 4000 firms shall be retrieved and several indicators should be gathered and validated for eligibility and accuracy. Moreover, this work involves cross-checking the data to establish a coherent and comprehensive final dataset, including occasional additional verifications after publication of the data in the Scoreboard report. <br> Doc Title: Data collection, validation & harmonisation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards <br> Contract Type: services

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Survey on the Role of Vehicle Generated Data on the Functioning of Vehicle and Spare Parts Distribution Markets and the Provision of Repair and Maintenance Services. Description: The survey aims to gain insights into the functioning of the EU vehicle repair and maintenance services, including the spare parts distribution market, as well as the role of vehicle data and the uptake of connected vehicles in the repair market outlook. The survey will provide evidence and information relevant to a study carried out by JRC in order to support the evaluation of the functioning of the Motor Vehicle Block Exemption Regulation (EU) No 461/2010 ("MVBER"). This evaluation must be carried out by the Commission as part of the review process of the MVBER. This exercise is led by DG COMP, and the study is part of an AA signed between DG COMP and JRC in order to provided technical and economic analysis of the trends underpinning recent developments in the vehicle repair and maintenance services market. <br> Doc Title: Survey on the role of vehicle generated data on the functioning of vehicle and spare parts distribution markets and the provision of repair and maintenance services <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 235000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2024-11-21. Closing Date: 2024-12-10. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE
output.Summary: Survey on the Role of Vehicle Generated Data on the Functioning of Vehicle and Spare Parts Distribution Markets and the Provision of Repair and Maintenance Services
output.Description: The survey aims to gain insights into the functioning of the EU vehicle repair and maintenance services, including the spare parts distribution market, as well as the role of vehicle data and the uptake of connected vehicles in the repair market outlook. The survey will provide evidence and information relevant to a study carried out by JRC in order to support the evaluation of the functioning of the Motor Vehicle Block Exemption Regulation (EU) No 461/2010 ("MVBER"). This evaluation must be carried out by the Commission as part of the review process of the MVBER. This exercise is led by DG COMP, and the study is part of an AA signed between DG COMP and JRC in order to provided technical and economic analysis of the trends underpinning recent developments in the vehicle repair and maintenance services market. <br> Doc Title: Survey on the role of vehicle generated data on the functioning of vehicle and spare parts distribution markets and the provision of repair and maintenance services <br> Contract Type: services

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Survey on the Role of Vehicle Generated Data on the Functioning of Vehicle and Spare Parts Distribution Markets and the Provision of Repair and Maintenance Services. Description: The survey aims to gain insights into the functioning of the EU vehicle repair and maintenance services, including the spare parts distribution market, as well as the role of vehicle data and the uptake of connected vehicles in the repair market outlook. The survey will provide evidence and information relevant to a study carried out by JRC in order to support the evaluation of the functioning of the Motor Vehicle Block Exemption Regulation (EU) No 461/2010 ("MVBER"). This evaluation must be carried out by the Commission as part of the review process of the MVBER. This exercise is led by DG COMP, and the study is part of an AA signed between DG COMP and JRC in order to provided technical and economic analysis of the trends underpinning recent developments in the vehicle repair and maintenance services market. <br> Doc Title: Survey on the role of vehicle generated data on the functioning of vehicle and spare parts distribution markets and the provision of repair and maintenance services <br> Contract Type: services. The survey will provide evidence and information relevant to a study carried out by JRC in order to support the evaluation of the functioning of the Motor Vehicle Block Exemption Regulation (EU) No 461/2010 ("MVBER"). input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Capacity Building and Experimentation for Innovation for Place-Based Transformation. Description: The aim of this contract is to develop and implement an integrated set of activities for equipping European practitioners and policy makers from EU and third countries associated to the programme Horizon Europe with the resources needed to design and implement innovation policies for place-based transformation in the frame of the “Innovation for place based transformation” initiative supported by the European Parliament, with the aim to: 1.Reinforce territorial capacities for transformative innovation policies by developing and delivering a Capacity Building programme; 2.Support a place-based transformative innovation policy experimentation arena, where territories can jointly engage into different thematic policy Experimentations Journeys, based around common challenges. To achieve these objectives the following activities are foreseen in the contract: •To design, develop and deliver a modular training and coaching package (capacity building) targeted to national, local and regional administrations, and their territorial stakeholders (business sector, academia and citizens representatives) from the EU and third countries associated to Horizon Europe. •To design and facilitate transformative innovation expertise and logistic for the support of a minimum 6 Experimentation Journeys (experimentation activities) to be proposed by the Joint Research Centre of the European Commission (EC-JRC) based on the analysis of the received expression of interest by participating territori.... Tender Value: 525000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2024-08-05. Closing Date: 2024-09-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN UNION SATELLITE CENTRE. Summary: Provision of Multisource Analytical Assessments. Description: The objective of this procurement procedure is the award of a multiple framework contract with reopening of competition with a maximum of 5 economic operators for the on-demand provision of analytical reports focusing on border security, cross-border crime, human smuggling, security and foreign policy in major countries of origin and transit to the EU member states and the Schengen associated states. These reports, known as Multisource Analytical Assessments (“MUSO”), will be based on open-sources information and geospatial analysis of earth observation data. They aim at supporting better-informed decision-making. The MUSO reports will use both quantitative and qualitative data collection and analysis methodologies, including literature reviews, predictive data analytics, behavioural sciences and geospatial analysis. The reports will cover the specific needs of the European Union Satellite Centre ("SatCen") under the Service Level Agreement concluded by and between the SatCen and the European Border and Coast Guard Agency (“Frontex”). <br> Doc Title: PROVISION OF MULTISOURCE ANALYTICAL ASSESSMENTS <br> Contract Type: services. Description: Research and Development Services and Related Consultancy Servicesopen Market Consultation of Procure4health for the Future Pre-Commercial Procurement of R&D Services Concerning the Preservation of Fr... <br> RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT SERVICES AND RELATED CONSULTANCY SERVICESOPEN MARKET CONSULTATION OF PROCURE4HEALTH FOR THE FUTURE PRE-COMMERCIAL PROCUREMENT OF R&D SERVICES CONCERNING THE PRESERVATION OF FRESH BIOLOGICAL SAMPLES <br> This Prior Information Notice announces the Open Market Consultation conducted by the PROCURE4HEALTH project and provides information about a potential future Pre-Commercial Procurement (PCP) of R&D services concerning the preservation of fresh biological samples. PROCURE4HEALTH aims to challenge the market to develop innovative solutions for advancing the preservation of biological samples for molecular biology studies. This initiative addresses the need for cost-efficient methods to preserve biological samples - ensuring the integrity and high yield of DNA, RNA, proteins, and metabolites - without requiring freezing and its associated infrastructure. These advancements are crucial for enhancing translational research, optimizing disease management, and improving patient outcomes in the context of precision medicine. PCP is an approach that allows public procurers to buy R&D from several competing suppliers in parallel, to compare alternative solution approaches, and to identify the best value-for-money solutions that the market can deliver to address their needs. It is split into three phases: solution design, prototype implementation, and validation and demonstration of the solutions. In PCP, there is a risk-benefit sharing under market conditions be.... input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Technical Support for the Development and Update of Euromod - Slovenia. Description: EUROMOD is a tax-benefit microsimulation model, which covers in a consistent manner the Member States of the European Union. The model allows to study the effects of taxes and social benefits on household incomes and work incentives for the population of each country and for the EU as a whole. EUROMOD is unique in its area as it features a great flexibility in the scope of its simulation and ensures cross-country consistency of the modelling approach and comparability of the results. The model has increasingly been used by the Commission services over the past few years, particularly so in the European Semester context. Additionally, the model represents a valuable research infrastructure for the academic community in the area of fiscal policy analysis, with highly cited research conducted using EUROMOD being published in top journals. The contracts are intended to provide the Commission with services that support the development and update of the microsimulation model EUROMOD for 7 country-specific modules: Slovenia (Lot 7) <br> Doc Title: TECHNICAL SUPPORT FOR THE DEVELOPMENT AND UPDATE OF EUROMOD - SLOVENIA <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 78000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2024-07-05. Closing Date: 2024-09-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE
output.Summary: Technical Support for the Development and Update of Euromod - Slovenia

EUROMOD is unique in its area as it features a great flexibility in the scope of its simulation and ensures cross-country consistency of the modelling approach and comparability of the results. Additionally, the model represents a valuable research infrastructure for the academic community in the area of fiscal policy analysis, with highly cited research conducted using EUROMOD being published in top journals. input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Capacity Building and Experimentation for Innovation for Place-Based Transformation. Description: The aim of this contract is to develop and implement an integrated set of activities for equipping European practitioners and policy makers from EU and third countries associated to the programme Horizon Europe with the resources needed to design and implement innovation policies for place-based transformation in the frame of the “Innovation for place based transformation” initiative supported by the European Parliament, with the aim to: 1.Reinforce territorial capacities for transformative innovation policies by developing and delivering a Capacity Building programme; 2.Support a place-based transformative innovation policy experimentation arena, where territories can jointly engage into different thematic policy Experimentations Journeys, based around common challenges. To achieve these objectives the following activities are foreseen in the contract: •To design, develop and deliver a modular training and coaching package (capacity building) targeted to national, local and regional administrations, and their territorial stakeholders (business sector, academia and citizens representatives) from the EU and third countries associated to Horizon Europe. •To design and facilitate transformative innovation expertise and logistic for the support of a minimum 6 Experimentation Journeys (experimentation activities) to be proposed by the Joint Research Centre of the European Commission (EC-JRC) based on the analysis of the received expression of interest by participating territori.... Published Date: 2024-06-20. Closing Date: 2025-06-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE
output.Summary: Capacity Building and Experimentation for Innovation for Place-Based Transformation
output.Description: The aim of this contract is to develop and implement an integrated set of activities for equipping European practitioners and policy makers from EU and third countries associated to the programme Horizon Europe with the resources needed to design and implement innovation policies for place-based transformation in the frame of the “Innovation for place based transformation” initiative supported by the European Parliament, with the aim to: 1.Reinforce territorial capacities for transformative innovation policies by developing and delivering a Capacity Building programme; 2.Support a place-based transformative innovation policy experimentation arena, where territories can jointly engage into different thematic policy Experimentations Journeys, based around common challenges. To achieve these objectives the following activities are foreseen in the contract: •To design, develop and deliver a modular training and coaching package (capacity building) targeted to national, local and regional administrations, and their territorial stakeholders (business sector, academia and citizens representatives) from the EU and third countries associated to Horizon Europe. •To design and facilitate transformative innovation expertise and logistic for the support of a minimum 6 Experimentation Journeys (experimentation activities) to be proposed by the Joint Research Centre of the European Commission (EC-JRC) based on the analysis of the received expression of interest by participating territori...

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Survey on Growers and Citizens- Preferences on Pest Management for Xylella Fastidiosa. Description: This contract aims to collect primary data through surveys to contribute the socioeconomic analysis of Xylella Fastidiosa (Xf) impacts and adoption of Integrated Pest Management (IPM). The survey will investigate the optimal combination of IPM measures from a supply (adoption by growers) and demand (societal valuation) point of view. Further, the survey will cover aspects related to attitudes and behaviours of the growers (e.g. innovativeness of the grower as well growers- preparedness to take environmental measures on the farm, including risk aversion, networking and knowledge sharing among growers.), aspects related to Xf (e.g. knowledge of the pest), and structural aspects of the farm. The target population of the survey will be EU growers and citizens. The survey must be done through CATI-WEB-CATI interviews for growers in the provinces of Córdoba, Jaén, and Alicante (Spain), and in the Apulia region in Italy. The survey for citizens will be implemented online, with citizens mainly from Andalusia, Comunidad Valenciana (Spain), and the Apulia region in Italy, but also from elsewhere in the two countries. <br> Doc Title: Survey on growers and citizens- preferences on pest management for Xylella Fastidiosa <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 165000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2024-06-10. Closing Date: 2024-09-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE
output.Summary: Survey on Growers and Citizens- Preferences on Pest Management for Xylella Fastidiosa
output.Description: This contract aims to collect primary data through surveys to contribute the socioeconomic analysis of Xylella Fastidiosa (Xf) impacts and adoption of Integrated Pest Management (IPM). The survey will investigate the optimal combination of IPM measures from a supply (adoption by growers) and demand (societal valuation) point of view. Further, the survey will cover aspects related to attitudes and behaviours of the growers (e.g. innovativeness of the grower as well growers- preparedness to take environmental measures on the farm, including risk aversion, networking and knowledge sharing among growers.), aspects related to Xf (e.g. knowledge of the pest), and structural aspects of the farm. The target population of the survey will be EU growers and citizens. The survey must be done through CATI-WEB-CATI interviews for growers in the provinces of Córdoba, Jaén, and Alicante (Spain), and in the Apulia region in Italy. The survey for citizens will be implemented online, with citizens mainly from Andalusia, Comunidad Valenciana (Spain), and the Apulia region in Italy, but also from elsewhere in the two countries. <br> Doc Title: Survey on growers and citizens- preferences on pest management for Xylella Fastidiosa <br> Contract Type: services
